description:
Fort is an effective firewall designed for Windows 7 and later versions, offering both simplicity and robustness.

Filter Modes that automatically Allow and Block programs by default
Programs rules - Single Program with an absolute path and variables support
Wildcard Programs - Multiple editable Programs with Wildcard path support (https://git-scm.com/docs/gitignore#_pattern_format)
Advanced Global or Program rules for maximum filtering of connections based on IP, Port, Protocol, ICMP, Direction, Area and Network Profile (https://github.com/tnodir/fort/wiki/Rules)
Support for 'SvcHost' individual Windows services filtering
IP Block/Allow lists via Zones
Block all traffic if Fort is not running
Block Internet Traffic, Internet and LAN or All Traffic Globally or per Program
Filer Local Network Addresses
Allow or Block child processes automatically based on their parent process and personalize inheritance of connections to all or specific child processes
Schedule Program rules to be allowed, blocked, removed or killed IN or AT a specific time.
Use Application Groups to easily manage multiple Program rules and enable groups at a specific time range each day
Limit bandwidth of applications via Application Groups
Kill processes and child processes support for Programs and Application Groups
Network Traffic monitoring with a Traffic Graph, Statistics and Quota
Log Blocked Connections
Alerts for new Programs
Run as a Service or Portable
Windows context menu integration
Command-Line support [-c prog add|del|allow|block|kill PATH (For Wildcard Programs use the first line: #Comment or PATH), -c block none|all|internet, -c zone update, -c prog export/import PATH-TO-JSON, -c home show)
Keyboard navigation friendly
Customizable icons and Hotkeys
Global Hotkeys support
Auto-Update
Backup
Password Protection
Open-Source
Report Issues - https://github.com/tnodir/fort/issues
Feedback & Questions - https://github.com/tnodir/fort/discussions

Important:
  * Fort Firewall has its own kernel driver based on the Windows Filtering Platform (WFP) and it is not compatible with Memory Integrity (Core Isolation)
  * Memory Integrity must be disabled for Fort Firewall to be installed (https://github.com/tnodir/fort/wiki/User-Guide#requirements)
